data.text: Continues this week @UNGeneva: UN Committee against Torture. Info & Documents here ➡️ https://t.co/Ui834cPsPE https://t.co/gWmQtE47BL
What's happening this week at the UN? #EndHumanTrafficking Day, #FriendshipDay, & more. List of events here: https://t.co/kSy5Kn2Dp8 https://t.co/zyf1xghzwc
Human trafficking is the 3rd largest crime worldwide. 30% of trafficking victims are children. Let’s #EndHumanTrafficking: https://t.co/nTFfO1r1A4 https://t.co/WBnJtWIxhU
Friendship between peoples, countries, cultures & individuals can inspire peace https://t.co/n3HcQD009j  #FriendshipDay https://t.co/NIaUdCCPhx

Annual @WMO photo competition is open for entries! The theme is "The Sun, the Earth & the Weather." Winning entries appear in 2019 WMO calendar. Details: https://t.co/ioYr70w4G8 https://t.co/ZqhJxp6i3K

Sunday is #GlobalTigerDay.

Less than 3900 wild 🐯🐯 are left in the world. Here's how you can #GoWildForLife and help protect them: https://t.co/eFIfhufpEn https://t.co/kNSRSWm1Sx
APPLY NOW: @IFC_org invites young people between 15-30 to submit multimedia projects on energy ⚡️, water💧& transport 🚇. Details: https://t.co/aJB6qskBI9 https://t.co/MnVsk2LFsb

UN Peacekeepers from Malawi leave their families behind and work in harsh conditions to protect others. We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/aUaGPW2qqb

From text messages to the typewriter, many applications have been designed for & by people with disabilities. @UNDP explores the potential for all in embracing diversity & meaningful co-design. 👇

https://t.co/bcy8KPlnyY

Imagine not being able to see sunlight or the road home -- reality for people with onchocerciasis, or River Blindness, in the yanomami area of Brazil & Venezuela. 

@PAHOWHO is helping eliminate the disease: https://t.co/Qt8fzVqjEF https://t.co/DRhIvm7S9N

Hepatitis B and C are chronic infections that may not show symptoms for years or decades. Timely testing and treatment can save lives. @WHO explains: https://t.co/m5gLY55Kep #TestTreatHepatitis https://t.co/i2v6PkwNgM

“I can build a solar lamp in 20 minutes.”

@UN_Women is helping women get the skills they need to find decent work -- and protect the planet. Martha from Guatemala shares her story: https://t.co/LefFMcekCC #GlobalGoals https://t.co/Hc1ijb6Blj
On Saturday's #WorldHepatitisDay @WHO calls on countries to step up efforts to eliminate hepatitis by 2030. https://t.co/3kt8KFnOOt #GlobalGoals https://t.co/R9k1Gde5Cq
Mali: @UN_MINUSMA provides support ahead of Sunday's election by transporting voting cards & ballots, escorting candidates and more. https://t.co/Zjk4DdTXPH #ServingForPeace https://t.co/SOhAe8hsM6

Saturday is #WorldHepatitisDay. More must be done to stop this silent killer. Learn more: https://t.co/m5gLY55Kep #TestTreatHepatitis https://t.co/YMQ40LhnaC

"In all my life, I've not known even five minutes of peace."
Four generations of a Rohingya refugee family describe a lifetime of injustices – and their hopes of returning to Myanmar.

Thursday is #MangroveDay. Mangroves are rare ecosystems on the boundary between land & sea which help address the effects of climate change. @UNESCO has more info: https://t.co/u8d81l0qbV https://t.co/r5yA1eoD1g

The UN: 
➡️ feeds 80M ppl
➡️ supplies vaccines for 45% of 🌍's children
➡️ protects 65M people forced to flee
➡️ tackles climate change
➡️ keeps peace with 117K peacekeepers 
➡️ fights poverty
➡️ promotes human rights
And much more: https://t.co/MGT7G5Mqxj https://t.co/DFkMNcu6CI
~800,000 people die due to suicide every year. But suicides are preventable. Find out more via @WHO https://t.co/drllacAgiV https://t.co/WQrVB6j259

-- UN humanitarian coordinator after trip to see 1st-hand hardships in Gaza Strip. 🎧 ⬇️
